intro: [WRONG START] Embilia variabilis, commonly known as the variable embelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The species is noted for its aromatic leaves and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
